required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intraobserver and Interobserver Reproducibility on Hip Clinical Assessment
clinical_study.official_title: Intraobserver and Interobserver Reproducibility on Hip Clinical Assessment

lead_sponsor.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.source: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

brief_summary.textblock: The functional assessment of the hip joint is complex and challenging. Reproducible measures are necessary to identify changes in the structures and functionality of the hip joint over time and to evaluate the outcomes of treatments. A systematic evaluation process is critical to evidence-based practice. However, there are few studies investigating the reproducibility of these measures such as muscle strength, range of motion (ROM) and hip functionality in healthy subjects.

detailed_description.textblock: Twenty subjects were randomized in two different days: (1) First evaluation of muscle strength, range of motion and single-leg squat performed by the evaluator 1; (2) Repeat the first evaluation with 3 different evaluators

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (evaluator 1) and after 4 days of rest repeat measures on day 2 with 3 different evaluators
primary_outcome.description: Measured with isometric hand hel dynamometry

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (evaluator 1) and after 4 days of rest repeat measures on day 2 with 3 different evaluators

other_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (evaluator 1) and after 4 days of rest repeat measures on day 2 with 3 different evaluators

facility.name: Exercise Research Laboratory, School of Physical Education, Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul
